file_content.text: There's been much turbulence in the Force.
It's... I'm glad to see you alive, Jedi. We all are.
After the First Son's shield collapsed, we suddenly felt every Child of the Emperor. Their darkness screams at us. They can never hide again.
And yet we didn't sense the First Son's death. Strange.
It wasn't necessary to kill him. Master Syo broke the shield, and is returned to us.
I found a better way.
It isn't strange, Master Satele. Master Syo is waiting in the caves below.
Master Syo is alive.
The First Son is safely contained by the man who knows him best. Syo Bakarn.
He's imprisoned, not dead.
You overcame the willpower of the First Son of the Emperor?
Incredible. If Syo's alive, we must bring him home to Tython, immediately.
Are you sure that's wise, Satele?
Syo faces a lifetime of keeping the First Son contained, and coming to terms with himself. He needs you.
Yes, he needs help.
He will have all the support we can offer.
I assure you, Master Syo is no longer a threat.
He's not dangerous.
That remains to be seen.
Take Syo into custody, but not on Tython. He's too much of a liability.
It's not. Send him elsewhere.
If you judge it necessary, we will find a safe place for him offworld.
Syo's devotion to the Republic was legendary. Now his legacy is one of treachery and evil.
We owe it to future generations of Padawans to tell Syo's story, truthfully, and warn them of such dangers.
He must be a cautionary tale.
I think Syo would welcome that.
If we allow his last days to overshadow an illustrious career, the First Son will have a final victory.
He did much good as well.
True. Syo Bakarn's name deserves its proper place, as a revered Jedi Master.
This is a Jedi matter. There's no need to report more than is necessary.
We can keep it quiet.
Considering the circumstances, we'd be wise to consider it.
Children of the Emperor are fleeing. Imperials are leaderless.
The Children who've been revealed are trying to escape; the Imperials are losing their leaders.
The forces in Capitol Square are in rout. The Republic still has a fight, but with the Guardian Holds retaken, we have an unshakeable foothold.
It will be years before the Empire can muster an assault like this again.
We've struck a decisive blow.
And without the Children of the Emperor, we have a chance to rebuild without fear.
We've worked for this for so long. It barely seems real.
Is there news about Nadia Grell and her homeworld?
Any word of Nadia?
There were reports of a large Imperial fleet close to Sarkhai, but no word from Padawan Grell herself.
Little Nadia must be alright.
I trust we are all convinced: The Treaty of Coruscant was a mistake that can never be repeated.
No more Imperial treaties.
I believe the Republic Senate has learned its lesson.
Better late than never.
You, and the Rift Alliance, have done more than we ever thought possible.
Unfortunately, it's been necessary to elect a new Supreme Chancellor--we must inform her of these developments. Support the battle on Corellia, then meet us on Coruscant.
Return to Coruscant when you can. It's been necessary to elect a new Supreme Chancellor, and she will want to recognize all you have done.
I was glad to be part of this.
